a1: Schema markup is structured data vocabulary (from schema.org) that helps search engines understand the content and context of web pages, enabling rich search results.
a2: JSON-LD (JavaScript Object Notation for Linked Data) is the recommended format for adding structured data to web pages. It is a script tag added to the HTML head section.
q3: Will schema markup improve my rankings?
a3: While schema markup does not directly improve rankings, it can earn rich snippets that increase click-through rates, which indirectly benefits SEO performance.
q4: Where do I add the JSON-LD code?
a4: Add the JSON-LD script tag in the head section of your HTML page, or just before the closing body tag. Google can process JSON-LD placed anywhere in the HTML.
